briefTitle: Targeting Acute Congestion With Tolvaptan in Congestive Heart Failure

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* ≥ 18 years of age
* Daily oral dose of furosemide between ≥ 40 mg(or equivalent)
* Identified within 24 hours of presentation, defined for purposes of this study as the time of initial dose of intravenous loop diuretic
* Prior clinical HF diagnosis that was treated with oral loop diuretics for at least 1 month
* Admission for acute decompensated Heart Failure (HF) as determined by

  * dyspnea at rest or with minimal exertion
  * Brain Natriuretic Peptide (BNP) \> 400 or NTproBNP \> 2000 pg/mL

AND at least one of the following additional signs and symptoms:

* Orthopnea
* Peripheral edema
* Elevated JVP (Jugular Venous Pressure)
* Pulmonary rales
* Congestion on Chest X-ray
* No plan for revascularization, cardiac transplant, of ventricular assist device implantation, or other cardiac surgery within 60 days of randomization
* Signed informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* Serum Na \> 140 meq/L
* Received IV vasoactive treatment or ultra-filtration therapy for HF since initial presentation
* Treatment plan during current hospitalization includes IV vasoactive treatment or ultra-filtration for HF
* Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP)\<90mmHg
* Serum-Cr\>3.5mg/dl or currently undergoing renal replacement therapy

  . Known underlying liver disease
* Hemodynamically significant arrhythmias
* ACS(Acute coronary syndrome) within 4 weeks prior to study entry
* Active myocarditis
* Hypertrophic obstructive, restrictive, constrictive cardiomyopathy
* Severe stenotic valvular disease
* Complex congenital heart disease
* Constrictive pericarditis
* Clinical evidence of digoxin toxicity
* Need for mechanical hemodynamic support
* Terminal illness (other than heart failure) with expected survival time of less than 1 year
* History of adverse reaction to Tolvaptan
* Enrollment or planned enrollment in another randomized clinical trial during this hospitalization
* Pregnant or breast-feeding
* Inability to comply with planned study procedures

outcomeMeasures.title: Dyspnea Improvement Measured by Likert Scale at 8 and 24 Hours
outcomeMeasures.description: The number of patients with at least moderate improvement (as reported by patient) in dyspnea Likert scale at both 8 AND 24 hours AND without the need for escalation of therapy due to worsening heart failure (rescue therapy) or death within 24 hours.

outcomeMeasures.title: Renal Function
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in Serum creatinine from baseline to 24, 48 and 72 hours

outcomeMeasures.title: Weight Loss
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in body weight from baseline to 24, 48, and 72 hours

outcomeMeasures.title: Fluid Loss
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline fluid balance at 24, 48, and 72 hours

outcomeMeasures.title: Dyspnea Likert
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of patients that experience moderate or greater improvement (patient reported) in dyspnea by 7 point Likert scale at 48 and 72 hours

outcomeMeasures.title: Hospital Stay
outcomeMeasures.description: Total days spent in hospital from baseline until discharge or death

outcomeMeasures.title: Worsening or Persistent Heart Failure or Death
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of patients with worsening heart failure or death

outcomeMeasures.title: Over-diuresis
outcomeMeasures.description: clinical evidence of volume depletion requiring intervention other than holding diuretics during the 72 hours after randomization

outcomeMeasures.title: Serum Sodium
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in serum sodium from baseline to 24, 48, and 72 hours

outcomeMeasures.title: Dyspnea 11 Point NRS
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in NRS for assessment of dyspnea from baseline to 24, 48, and 72 hours (scale ranges from 0-No difficulty breathing to 10-Difficulty as bad as you can imagine)

outcomeMeasures.title: Freedom From Congestion
outcomeMeasures.description: Jugular Venous Pressure (JVP) \< 8 cm, no orthopnea, trace peripheral edema or less, and will be assessed at 24, 48, and 72 hours

outcomeMeasures.title: Development of Worsening Renal Function
outcomeMeasures.description: increase in serum creatinine ≥ 0.3mg/dl from randomization at any time point during 72 hours after randomization

outcomeMeasures.title: Days Hospitalized or Deceased
outcomeMeasures.description: Total days hospitalized or deceased during the 30 days after randomization

outcomeMeasures.title: All Cause Death or Rehospitalization
outcomeMeasures.description: All cause death or rehospitalization (to include unscheduled clinic visits or ED visits) at 30 days (Kaplan-Meier and 95% confidence interval)
